title: COVID-19 Vaccine and Testing
cleaned_text: Vaccines for UNLV Students, Faculty, and Staff Including Boosters and Third Doses UNLV students, as well as faculty, staff and their dependents who are 12 years old and older can make appointments for COVID-19 vaccinations at the [Student Health Center (SHC)](/studentwellness/health-center) and [Faculty and Staff Treatment (FAST) Center](/studentwellness/fast). The Student Wellness Center is located on the UNLV campus on the first floor of the Student Recreation and Wellness Center. COVID-19 Booster Shots: Pfizer, Moderna and Johnson & Johnson are available to those who previously received primary vaccine series and meet [eligibility requirements](https://covid.southernnevadahealthdistrict.org/vaccine/about-booster-doses/). Additional Doses for Immunocompromised: Third doses of Pfizer and Moderna are available for those who are moderately or severely immunocompromised and meet [eligibility requirements](https://covid.southernnevadahealthdistrict.org/additional-vaccine-information/#third-doses).These doses are not considered booster shots but are to assist in the immune response to the vaccine for those who are immunocompromised. Cost: There is no cost for COVID-19 vaccination, including third doses and boosters Schedule: To make an appointment, students may call the SHC at [702-895-3370](tel:702-895-3370), and faculty, staff and dependents may call the FAST Center at [702-895-0630](tel:702-895-0630). What to bring: Please bring your Rebel Card or another picture ID. If you have received one or more previous doses of COVID-19 vaccine, you must bring your vaccination card or record with you. COVID Antigen and PCR Testing for UNLV Students, Faculty/Staff UNLV Student Health Center (SHC) and Faculty and Staff Treatment (FAST) Center offer rapid COVID antigen testing for $9 and PCR testing for $70 in [ our laboratory](/studentwellness/lab). The service is available to students, faculty, staff, and dependents (age 12 years and older). Both tests determine if an individual is currently infected with COVID-19 with or without symptoms. Test results are usually available in approximately one hour for antigen testing and two hours for PCR testing. Those without symptoms may call the SHC/FAST Center Laboratory at [702-895-0280](tel:702-895-0280) to schedule an appointment. Those experiencing COVID symptoms are encouraged to contact the SHC (for students) at [702-895-3370](tel:702-895-3370) or the FAST Center (for faculty, staff, and dependents) at [702-895-0630](tel:702-895-0630) to schedule an appointment with a health care provider for assessment and lab testing.
